name: Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)
description: A common human skin condition that causes the skin to become inflamed, itchy, red, cracked, and rough. This condition is not contagious.

stages.Acute: Vesicles (blisters) on a background of red, inflamed skin.
stages.Chronic: Thickened, leathery skin (lichenification) and increased skin markings from persistent scratching.

causes: A combination of genetic and environmental factors, often related to an overactive immune system.
risk_factors: Family history of eczema, asthma, or hay fever. Living in urban areas with higher levels of pollution.
preventive_measures: Moisturize skin frequently, avoid harsh soaps and known irritants, and manage stress.
solution: Topical corticosteroid creams and ointments to reduce inflammation. Moisturizers (emollients) are used to keep the skin hydrated. Antihistamines may help with itching.
